title: Making Social Work Count: A National Curriculum Development Programme Pioneered in Three Universities
abstractText:
The project aims to develop a shared common curriculum for teaching of quantitative research to create improvements in the level of quantitative knowledge and skills within social work graduates.

Phase 1 of the research (2012-13) will involve developing increased provision for quantitative teaching through a shared curriculum at 3 pioneer universities (Bath, Bedfordshire and Queen's Belfast). The curriculum consists of 10 “sessions” focused on quantitative research within social work, starting with the need for numbers through to basic statistics. In addition, resources for more advanced study will be provided. Each session will include resources for teaching, references and interactive materials to support teaching and learning but aimed at allowing flexible use across different types of course.

Phase 2 will involve rolling this out to other interested Universities (2013-15). An evaluation will compare knowledge and views of students and staff, after the first year and at the end of the project. This work is complemented by the RDI proposal aimed at teaching and pedagogic support.
